title: How to Make Filipino Style Spaghetti

steps.headline: If using hot dogs, cut into 1-inch logs.
Mince garlic.
steps.description: If making sauce from scratch, dice tomatoes.

steps.headline: Heat a 3-quart or larger pot over medium heat.
steps.description: Add ground beef and minced garlic and cook until meat turns brown. Pour off fat if desired.

steps.headline: Make the sauce:
steps.description: If using pasta sauce: Add pasta sauce, hot dogs/Vienna sausage, and herbs. Bring to a simmer, then stir in sugar and salt and pepper. If making sauce from scratch: Add tomatoes, tomato paste, and stock to pot. Bring to a boil, then add herbs, sugar, salt and pepper, and hot dogs/Tender Juicy Hotdogs and lower to a simmer. Simmer for 45 minutes. Correct the seasoning for the sauce. Let simmer over low heat until ready to serve.

steps.headline: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
steps.description: Add a dash of salt and 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) oil to the pasta water. Drain well under cold water.

steps.headline: Pour sauce over spaghetti and top with grated cheese.

text: If using hot dogs, cut into 1-inch logs.  Mince garlic. If making sauce from scratch, dice tomatoes. Heat a 3-quart or larger pot over medium heat. Add ground beef and minced garlic and cook until meat turns brown. Pour off fat if desired. Make the sauce: If using pasta sauce: Add pasta sauce, hot dogs/Vienna sausage, and herbs. Bring to a simmer, then stir in sugar and salt and pepper. If making sauce from scratch: Add tomatoes, tomato paste, and stock to pot. Bring to a boil, then add herbs, sugar, salt and pepper, and hot dogs/Tender Juicy Hotdogs and lower to a simmer. Simmer for 45 minutes. Correct the seasoning for the sauce. Let simmer over low heat until ready to serve. Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Add a dash of salt and 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) oil to the pasta water. Drain well under cold water. Pour sauce over spaghetti and top with grated cheese. Serve hot. Finished.
